resource.http://dev.llgc.org.uk/sas/full_text: Hybrid performance: this concert by La Poudrière incorporates a "typical" noise instrumentation (described in detail in the previous picture) and two traditonnal instruments: a violoncello (right) and a hurdy-gurdy (left). Hybrid concerts are not in any way "special": as a genre, noise constantly feeds from other musical styles and practices. As "noise music" is not a clearly situated genre, hybridation and mixing is a large part of its identity.
resource.chars: Hybrid performance: this concert by La Poudrière incorporates a "typical" noise instrumentation (described in detail in the previous picture) and two traditonnal instruments: a violoncello (right) and a hurdy-gurdy (left). Hybrid concerts are not in any way "special": as a genre, noise constantly feeds from other musical styles and practices. As "noise music" is not a clearly situated genre, hybridation and mixing is a large part of its identity.
